sanskrit_verse:
स्वर्गार्थमुभयार्थं वा विप्रानाराधयेत्तु सः ।
जातब्राह्मणशब्दस्य सा ह्यस्य कृतकृत्यता ॥ १०.१२२॥
transliteration:
svargārtham ubhayārthaṁ vā viprān ārādhayet tu saḥ |
jātabrāhmaṇaśabdasya sā hy asya kṛtakṛtyatā || 10.122||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who worships Brahmins for the sake of heaven or for both worldly and heavenly rewards thereby fulfills the very purpose of being called a twice-born.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in alignment with Dharma through conscious worship and reverence.
Causation is established by intention directed toward higher consciousness realization.
Capacity-based responsibility arises from one's ability to engage in Vedic ritual and spiritual discipline.
Restoration logic operates through completion of prescribed acts that elevate collective consciousness.
Consciousness alignment occurs when actions are performed with dharmic intent and recognition of spiritual hierarchy.
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent performs ritual worship of Brahmin AND intent includes svarga OR dual benefit THEN agent fulfills 'twice-born' status.
IF individual engages in Vedic conduct THEN capacity for dharmic responsibility is activated.
IF action aligns with cosmic order THEN societal integration is restored without punitive measure.
IF spiritual duty is executed THEN legal identity as dvija is affirmed automatically.
supreme_court_application: In adjudication concerning personal law and caste-based rights, this verse establishes that performance of Vedic duties—not birth alone—confers juridical status as twice-born. The Supreme Court must recognize conduct-based validation over hereditary claim where Dharma is at issue.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa lies in observable act of worship aligned with śruti. Anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as sequential elevation through intentional devotion. Responsibility is proportional to access and execution of Vedic practice. There is no punishment; only recognition of achieved ontological state.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Individual must demonstrate ongoing engagement in Vedic worship.
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Acknowledgment of duties corresponding to twice-born status.
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Provision of resources and guidance for sustained dharmic living.
Integrity Reintegration Framework: Social recognition synchronized with demonstrated spiritual conduct.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law restores reality to its non-punitive foundation, wherein consciousness alone adjudicates truth. Svaha.
